title: chaser15
author: chaser15
content: In a simple description, the buy-in feature is buying the bonus round feature of a certain casino game, if available. By buying the buy-in, you will trigger the bonus game feature of that certain casino game that might give you a good chance of getting good profits. The bonus game obviously varies per casino game that's why before deciding to purchase a buy-in feature, "try to check first what the bonus game of that casino game looks like".Just recently, got a decent win playing at DinoPolis by the game provider, Push Gaming. The feature I purchased is worth $47 for a $0.5 bet amount per spin. What I like about their bonus (buy-in) is; users have a chance of locking a certain reel for a better chance of hitting a good win and free spins can be replenished. Yes, the bonus can be triggered 3 times.Obviously, luck still plays a role here but just want to know what are your favorite casino games with a buy-in feature. Either you want those games because of the number of free spins given, good multipliers, cheap cost, and many more. I will definitely check those.

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Quote from: chaser15 on November 27, 2022, 07:46:24 PMIn a simple description, the buy-in feature is buying the bonus round feature of a certain casino game, if available. By buying the buy-in, you will trigger the bonus game feature of that certain casino game that might give you a good chance of getting good profits. The bonus game obviously varies per casino game that's why before deciding to purchase a buy-in feature, "try to check first what the bonus game of that casino game looks like".Just recently, got a decent win playing at DinoPolis by the game provider, Push Gaming. The feature I purchased is worth $47 for a $0.5 bet amount per spin. What I like about their bonus (buy-in) is; users have a chance of locking a certain reel for a better chance of hitting a good win and free spins can be replenished. Yes, the bonus can be triggered 3 times.Obviously, luck still plays a role here but just want to know what are your favorite casino games with a buy-in feature. Either you want those games because of the number of free spins given, good multipliers, cheap cost, and many more. I will definitely check those.Luck plays a role yes but in games where you can use the buy in feature you can for example play all your predetermined bankroll to play by trying your luck in spending all your balance in these buy ins for the bonus round/feature of the game.I like extreme volatility games when it comes to buy ins so I think for me Money Train 3  from Relax Gaming is well known for its huge volatility so if for example you try 500 dollars all in buying the feature several times it can happen that one time you to hit for example over x30000-40000 of multiplier and this money buying the feature to be well spent,of course the majority of the times you will lose money.If you try to play normally then don't bother with such games as you will get the feature extremely on rare occasions.

comments.author: serjent05
comments.body: My favorite Casino games with a buy-in features are the ones produced by Push Gaming especially  Land of zenith. It really triggers a player adrenaline because it started slow and getting fast as it progress.  Though it isn't advisable for players that has epileptic tendency due to the fast flashing of game images.You can try to play it here.[1]A bit description of the game.QuoteDeveloper Push Gaming famously takes their time to fine-tune slots before release to ensure each element is just how they like it. That being the case, it has been some time since we last crossed paths in the Mesopotamian deserts of Wheel of Wonders. From old world ancient history, we turn to a brand new one in a slot that has been titled Land of Zenith. Built around a retro-futuristic  theme, it's been expertly integrated with several smart extras, out of which the Hypermode mechanic is the stand-out feature.QuoteIt is a 6 reel 30 payline ontraption surrounded by brass decorations, including the all-important Disc Mechanism. On the screen’s periphery, floating cities hover amongst clouds as flying machines traverse between them. Aurally, Land of Zenith's music is quite subdued. It’s dreamy, yet a little too dreamy perhaps at moments where it would’ve benefited from a tad bit more energy.Here is the example gameplay of the game: https://youtu.be/DWJklQk1qBMQuote from: swogerino on November 27, 2022, 09:01:15 PMLuck plays a role yes but in games where you can use the buy in feature you can for example play all your predetermined bankroll to play by trying your luck in spending all your balance in these buy ins for the bonus round/feature of the game.I like extreme volatility games when it comes to buy ins so I think for me Money Train 3  from Relax Gaming is well known for its huge volatility so if for example you try 500 dollars all in buying the feature several times it can happen that one time you to hit for example over x30000-40000 of multiplier and this money buying the feature to be well spent,of course the majority of the times you will lose money.If you try to play normally then don't bother with such games as you will get the feature extremely on rare occasions.True luck has a huge play in Buy-in features those who have just enough bankroll of a single buy-in can be considered to have an all-in wager.  The good thing about this buy-in is that our money isn't lost in an instant but instead we can see it slowly growing or slowly depreciating as the bonus round progress.  I agree with you that it is best to buy extreme volatility games bonus because if you got lucky, you can get gigantic profit since extreme volatility games either give you huge amount or nothing.[1] https://www.bigwinboard.com/land-of-zenith-push-gaming-slot-review/

comments.author: o48o
comments.body: Quote from: chaser15 on November 27, 2022, 07:46:24 PM-cut-Just recently, got a decent win playing at DinoPolis by the game provider, Push Gaming. The feature I purchased is worth $47 for a $0.5 bet amount per spin. What I like about their bonus (buy-in) is; users have a chance of locking a certain reel for a better chance of hitting a good win and free spins can be replenished. Yes, the bonus can be triggered 3 times.-cut-I have to check that, thanks. I don't use buy-in feature except in demo mode, to see what i would be getting if i was lucky. And when i finally get one, it just feels better when i am getting it for "free".My favourite game with buy in feature was first one i tried. It was Demi Gods (2) i think, from Spinomenal. Because every time i got it it had different set of rules, and ways to get money. I think there were like "5-8" steps with different kinds of spin setups. Everyone being highly profitable and fun to watch. There's currently slots challenge in stake so i am going to try out Dinopolis next.

comments.author: goinmerry
comments.body: Nice topic. I'm also a fan of casino games with buy-in features although we really need some damn luck to win or not.Will check the previous games I played with Stake. My top criteria are those games with the cheapest cost.In Dinopolis, as OP shared, is the $47 the cheapest cost of buy-in there? If it is, that was not a considered budget meal for me.

There's currently slots challenge in stake so i am going to try out Dinopolis next.That's weird but for most gamblers, it should make them feel upset if they get a decent win after playing in demo mode. They will say that " tsk, if only I use real money" and I think there are gamblers who will try to play for real after that but we know what can usually happen next. That is they will lose this time and they will regret it again.Aside from the slot game that the op have shared, I think the slot game that you have shared there is also worth trying. I like its mechanics and it doesn't seem boring because every time we get a bonus, there is something new that we will witness but good luck by the way on the challenge that you're going to try.

comments.author: Accardo
comments.created_time: November 28, 2022, 08:46:03 AMLast edit: November 28, 2022, 09:10:36 AM by Accardo
comments.body: Bonus buying is interesting when playing Money Train 2 from Relax Gaming, but the interest diminishes along with the losing outcome. If I stake 100× my bet about $150 to unlock the money cart bonus, and end up wining $30 I'll lose interest because I just lost $120 in a bit. However, the wining can be encouraging, which depends on discipline and bank roll. Out of curiosity a player can waste more money with feature buying than playing gradually. Some games offer bonuses after spinning more than 10× it all requires patience. Though, if your bank roll can withstand the loses then its not a problem.

comments.author: Bitinity
comments.body: Push Gaming bonus buy feature is the worst if you ask me, the worst here related to the possible outcome. I prefer to choose the games from Pragmatic/No Limit City or Relax Gaming than Push Gaming. If I have to mention specific games I like, here is my list: 1. Pragmatic: Fruit Party and Gates of Olympus2. No Limit City: Tombstone and Book of Shadows3. Relax Gaming: TNT Tumble and Money Train 2

comments.author: Jating
comments.body: Quote from: Bitinity on November 28, 2022, 09:32:29 AMPush Gaming bonus buy feature is the worst if you ask me, the worst here related to the possible outcome. I prefer to choose the games from Pragmatic/No Limit City or Relax Gaming than Push Gaming. If I have to mention specific games I like, here is my list: 1. Pragmatic: Fruit Party and Gates of Olympus2. No Limit City: Tombstone and Book of Shadows3. Relax Gaming: TNT Tumble and Money Train 2 Right, I love the Tombstone of No Limit City as far as buy-in feature. Everyone I try to 'take advantage' of this feature it seems to be giving me a good win. Next on the list is Book of Shadows already in regular games I've been extremely lucky with in.Money Train 2 as well, good to have buy-in feature and it's worth to used it as per my experience.Glad that you mentioned Pragmatic, but I haven't played with them for a long time like the Fruit party because I'm not a fan of that UI,

comments.author: Beparanf
comments.body: Pragmatic Play is the best for me specifically Gate of Olympus and Sweet Bonanze. This provider offers a very good graphics and not too high volatility games with high multiplier compared to other provider like Hacksaw and Push that always very hard to hit any huge. Pragmatic Play always have a tournaments and events like cash hunt on all of there games like what they launch last Halloween when they partner on Duelbits for there huge contest. Pragmatic is slowly dominating the slot market that makes them expand to live casino games due to there popularity. I think they are the closest company that rival evolution gaming on slots and live games toe to toe. Or maybe they are already the number/number 1 all the time.

comments.author: iv4n
comments.body: My list is long, really long... Pragmatic: -Power of Thor Megaways -Sword of Ares-Great Rhino Megaways-Sweet Bonanza-The Dog House Megaways-The Hand of MidasNo Limit:-Book of Shadows-Fire in the Hole-San Quentin-Mental Relax:-Money Train 2 (I saw there's 3, but didn't try it yet)-Snake Arena-Iron Bank-Marching LegionsQuick Spin:-Sticky Bandits 3 Most Wanted-Cash Truck-Big Bad Wolf MegawaysHacksaw:-Chaos Crew-Gladiator LegendsThe list is even longer, I probably missed a few good slots from each of these providers, and I missed a few providers as well. On these slots, I have many bonus buys. Bonus buy is a fun option, it's the question is it better to buy a bonus or to play normal spins and try to get one? It's pure gambling either way. I busted my balance many times with normal spins without winning a bonus round, in those moments I feel like it would be better to simply buy it, but you can't imagine how many times I got under x5 after buying a bonus! Simple math, $20 bonus buy, under x5 is less than a $1. Never forget about the responsible gambling quote, never spend more than you can afford to lose! Slots are crazy, they can be very generous but they can wipe out your balance in minutes. So don't play them if you are not ready for some loses, normal spins or bonus buying is almost the same.

comments.author: maydna
comments.body: I used the buy-in feature to get into Fruit Party, but I forgot how much it was. But I remember the bet I used was $0.2 per spin. But I only win a little money and only make or return the money I use for the feature buy-in. And it was luck that I got it because I could get back the money I used to buy that feature.Indeed, buying a buy-in feature can give you big wins, but if it is a slot game, it will depend on our luck. If we are not lucky, we will not be able to win a lot of money and lose the capital used for the buy-in feature.

If I have to mention specific games I like, here is my list: Fortunately, PUSH GAMING is more friendly towards accepted regions compared to other popular game providers. Using VPN might solve the problem but to avoid problems in the future, I won't consider doing it that way.

For me, Push is available almost everywhere, but on some sites not! Until recently I couldn't play Pragmatic anywhere without a VPN! But at Chipstars and Metaspins I can play Pragmatic, as well as some other providers that are not available for me in other casinos..Quote from: Metaspins.com on November 08, 2022, 04:33:11 PMQuote from: iv4n on November 07, 2022, 11:22:43 AMI like the choice of games, I enjoyed playing Pragmatic for a long time, since I stopped using VPN. But here I played it freely, which is great for sure, I just wonder is there some catch? Thanks a lot for the link, next time we will use it for sure!And we’re happy to hear that you enjoy playing Pragmatic without extra steps at our casino! comments.author: harizen
comments.body: Because of this topic, I checked those casino games that I played before.To my surprise, the game where I won my first good return thru a buy-in feature is now unavailable. I'm having difficulty finding that game when I browse the Stake website so I decided to log in to my account and check my recent games. When I click the game, it's not available now.The game is called "Hippopop by Yggdrasil". I don't know if this game is available on other casino gambling sites as the game provider itself, Yggdrasil, is already not present on the Stake website.

comments.author: STT
comments.body: I prefer getting the special bonus feature to a game naturally through good luck even if randomly that leaves me without sometimes.  I know the buy-in is convenient and definetly an attractive option to take and save alot of hassle but I also literally like feeling like its a win just to trip the bonus round feature even thats really not the case the bonus can end without any great reward.  Its part of the game, I dont want to take the short cut though if Im short of patience I might change my mind also.

comments.author: Yatsan
comments.body: Quote from: STT on November 28, 2022, 11:44:13 PMI prefer getting the special bonus feature to a game naturally through good luck even if randomly that leaves me without sometimes.  I know the buy-in is convenient and definetly an attractive option to take and save alot of hassle but I also literally like feeling like its a win just to trip the bonus round feature even thats really not the case the bonus can end without any great reward.  Its part of the game, I dont want to take the short cut though if Im short of patience I might change my mind also.To some people it gives more of a challenge or simply making it more fun. But to some, perhaps those who are just into profit, they'd choose convenience or getting it in an instant to generate profit from bonuses. Eitherway, nothing's wrong; it is just a matter of gambler's preference. On my case, I'm siding with people who would prefer getting it through unlocking the feature such as complying with some in game requirements or such. I don't know, maybe I am just satisfied with making it literally as a "bonis" from playing. But with games having buy-in features,  unfortunately they are already mentioned by users in this topic and they are Money train and that zenith thing. Well, I enjoyed it but I just enjoy other gambling games more; oreferrably traditionals.
